title: 103_hr5098
content: The "Fort Peck Tribes-Montana Compact Act of 1994" approves and ratifies the Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact. It also confirms agreements related to the use of water rights. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes may enter into Water Agreements for water rights use, subject to Secretary approval within specific timeframes. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes may enter Water Agreements subject to Secretary approval within specific timeframes. Parties can enforce agreement provisions as per section 1361 of title 28, US Code. The Department of the Interior must treat certain information related to agreements as privileged tribal information. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes can enter Water Agreements with Secretary approval within set timeframes. The Tribes are restricted from authorizing the use of tribal water rights outside the Basin. An "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" is established in the Treasury, funded by a percentage of receipts from integrated programs of the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin Project. Interest accrued on fund deposits is kept in a separate Treasury account. The Secretary of the Treasury shall deposit interest accruing on fund deposits in a separate account. The interest can be used by the Secretary of the Interior for tribal economic development and land acquisition within the Reservation. Payments from the fund are nonreimbursable and nonreturnable, and will not affect Federal services or programs for the Tribes. The fund's aggregate amount shall not exceed $50,000,000. The fund deposits are nonreimbursable and nonreturnable. Payments under this Act will not reduce or deny any Federal services or programs for the Tribes. Payments are not subject to Federal or State income tax and will not impact power rates. No funds will be distributed on a per capita basis. The Tribes waive claims against the United States in exchange for fulfilling the Act's requirements. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact refers to the compact ratified by the Tribes and the State of Montana in 1985. The Reservation is defined as the Fort Peck Indian Reservation. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of the Interior. The Tribes are the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes of the Fort Peck Indian Reservation. Tribal water right is defined in the Fort Peck-Montana Compact. The Fund is the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund.
